info.title: Promotions & Taxes API v2
info.description:
> Check the new [Promotions onboarding guide](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/promotions-overview). We created this guide to improve the onboarding experience for developers at VTEX. It assembles all documentation on our Developer Portal about Promotions and is organized by focusing on the developer's journey.

 The Promotions & Taxes API allows you to manage and retrieve all coupons from your VTEX store.

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

get.description: Retrieves the list of all active coupons.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

get.description: Retrieves the list of all archived coupons.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

get.description: Retrieves information from a specific coupon batch based on its `groupingKey`.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: groupingKey
parameters.description: Coupon grouping key, which is the prefix for the coupon batch's generated codes.

put.description: Changes information from a specific coupon batch configuration based on its `groupingKey`.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: groupingKey
parameters.description: Coupon grouping key, which is the prefix for the coupon batch's generated codes.

requestBody.description: Request body to edit coupon batch configuration information.

schema.description: Array of strings with coupon batch codes.

text/plain.example: It is not possible to edit an archived coupon group.

get.description: Retrieves a specific coupon batch's list of codes.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: groupingKey
parameters.description: Coupon grouping key, which is the prefix for the coupon batch's generated codes.

schema.description: Array of strings with coupon batch codes.

put.description: Archives a coupon batch and its respective codes.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: groupingKey
parameters.description: Coupon grouping key, which is the prefix for the coupon batch's generated codes.

post.description: Creates one or more coupon batches.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

schema.description: Array of objects containing coupon batches information.

text/plain.example: A list of multiple coupon configurations is required

put.description: Unarchives a coupon batch and its respective codes.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: groupingKey
parameters.description: Coupon grouping key, which is the prefix for the coupon batch's generated codes.

get.summary: Get usage count for a single coupon
get.description: Returns the number of times a specific single coupon was used, based on its `couponCode`.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: couponCode
parameters.description: Single coupon code.

schema.description: Number of times the single coupon was used to place orders.

get.summary: Get usage count for a coupon batch
get.description: Returns the number of times a coupon batch was used, based on its `groupingKey`.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: groupingKey
parameters.description: Coupon grouping key, which is the prefix for the coupon batch's generated codes.

schema.description: Number of times the coupon batch was used to place orders.

utmSource.title: utmSource
utmSource.description: UTM source related to the coupon, which indicates the source of the traffic, that is, from which site, advertiser, or publication the user came from. It is mandatory to provide either `utmSource` or `utmCampaign`.

utmCampaign.title: utmCampaign
utmCampaign.description: UTM campaign related to the coupon, which indicates the campaign that defines a particular marketing context. It is mandatory to provide either `utmSource` or `utmCampaign`.

expirationIntervalPerUse.title: expirationIntervalPerUse
expirationIntervalPerUse.description: This option is non-editable and visible only for existing coupons configured with this limitation in previous versions of the Coupons module. When enabled, it determines how many days after purchase the coupon will be available for use again.

maxItemsPerClient.title: maxItemsPerClient
maxItemsPerClient.description: This option is non-editable and visible only for existing coupons configured with this limitation in previous versions of Coupons. When enabled, it determines the maximum amount of products to which the coupon can be applied. The defined quantity is valid for one or more purchases by the same customer.

maxUsage.title: maxUsage
maxUsage.description: The maximum number of times the coupon can be used, if the coupon has limited usage.

items.description: Object containing each coupon batch and its configuration information.

key.title: key
key.description: Coupon grouping key, which is the prefix for the coupon batch's generated codes.

amount.title: amount
amount.description: Amount of codes in the coupon batch.

lastModifiedUtc.title: lastModifiedUtc
lastModifiedUtc.description: Date when the coupon was modified for the last time, in the UTC format.

utmSource.title: utmSource
utmSource.description: UTM source related to the coupon, which indicates the source of the traffic, that is, from which site, advertiser, or publication the user came from.

utmCampaign.title: utmCampaign
utmCampaign.description: UTM campaign related to the coupon, which indicates the campaign that defines a particular marketing context.

isArchived.title: isArchived
isArchived.description: Determines whether the coupon is archived (`true`) or not (`false`).

maxItemsPerClient.description: This option is non-editable and visible only for existing coupons configured with this limitation in previous versions of Coupons.
